page.title: 16North Downs soil and farming
page.content:
Situated on top of the{North Downs}the area around{West Kingsdown}has a {heavy, clay soil.} The{clay}overlays the natural{chalk}of of the Downs, varying in thickness from{several {centimetres to a few metres.} The change in thickness of the clay overlay can be quite dramatic, even within a few square metres.
{Farming,}reflecting the relatively {poor quality of the soil}is predominantly{cereals}and{sheep. There is no evidence of any other crops or livestock rearing within the area as surveyed. Sheep flourish on the{rough grazing}where the clay overlay is thin or non-existant. The rest of the area is given over to cereals.
